The patch set is failed because the missing of patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/63517. Set this patch set as WorkInProgress.

Updated code to support retry mechanism for pldmtool commands.
This address issue pldmtool will end with no response message after 4800 ms without any retry. There is number-of-request-retries option in pldm repo to configure the number of retry to send one pldm message when it is failed.

The build error come from other code:

FAILED: softoff/pldm-softpoweroff.p/softoff.cpp.o 
c++ -Isoftoff/pldm-softpoweroff.p -I. -I.. -I/usr/local/include -fdiagnostics-color=never -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -Wall -Winvalid-pch -Wextra -Wpedantic -Werror -std=c++20 -Og -g -Wno-psabi -DLIBPLDMRESPONDER -DOEM_IBM -DBOOST_ASIO_DISABLE_THREADS -DBOOST_ALL_NO_LIB -DBOOST_SYSTEM_NO_DEPRECATED -DBOOST_ERROR_CODE_HEADER_ONLY -DBOOST_COROUTINES_NO_DEPRECATION_WARNING -MD -MQ softoff/pldm-softpoweroff.p/softoff.cpp.o -MF softoff/pldm-softpoweroff.p/softoff.cpp.o.d -o softoff/pldm-softpoweroff.p/softoff.cpp.o -c ../softoff/softoff.cpp
../softoff/softoff.cpp: In member function ‘int pldm::SoftPowerOff::getSensorInfo()’:
../softoff/softoff.cpp:263:14: error: ‘pdr’ may be used uninitialized [-Werror=maybe-uninitialized]
  263 |         auto possibleStatesStart = pdr->possible_states;
      |              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../softoff/softoff.cpp:249:32: note: ‘pdr’ was declared here
  249 |         pldm_state_sensor_pdr* pdr;
      |                                ^~~
cc1plus: all warnings being treated as errors
Hi Thu, I have several comments.
Please add a patch to fix this.
Done
The functions provided by the `libpldm/requester/pldm.h` API are deprecated. Please use the APIs provided by `libpldm/transport.h` and `libpldm/transport/mctp-demux.h` instead.
Done
Again, this goes away when you move to the `libpldm/transport.h` APIs. Please use the appropriate `pldm_transport*_destroy()` functions instead.
Done
I realise the existing code had this branch, but why do we need it?
The code is removed when change to use transport APIs in libpldm.

Again, replace this with the transport APIs. In this case you will need to construct your own timeout/retry from `pldm_transport_send_msg()`, `pldm_transport_poll()` and `pldm_transport_recv_msg()` (as you don't want the timeout behaviour of `pldm_transport_send_recv_msg()`).
Done
This code doesn't appear to handle it?
Done

I think it should be possible to override the number of retries on the command-line. I'm not entirely comfortable with just baking in this behaviour when we don't have the correct requester semantics implemented.
I will add option to support override number of retries.

Updated code.
The "-n" option is added.
The pldmtool functional will not be changed when the option is not included.
Thanks Thu, allowing the user to specify the number of retries makes mem ore comfortable. I do have a couple of minor requests though.
If you saw this message, would you find it helpful? IMO we should print the error code value as well. That would provide a bit more insight.
I added return code in the output message.
We can drop the `return rc;` here ...
Done
... and switch this to `return rc;`.
Done
A bit of a nitpick, but maybe `--retry-count`?
Done
This isn't the symbol that's used in the code. Can we make the commit message use terminology consistent with the code change?
Done
This isn't true any more?
Done
Same consistency request as above.
Done
Hi Thu, I didn't consider the commit message when I gave the +1. I have some minor comments there.

This is a little confusing.

rc which is not a PLDM_SUCCESS is also something that can be tested with PLDM tool, having that as a basis for retry does not feel right to me.

Usually the source of re-tries - is the absence of response in a particular time interval (instance id expiration timeout).

I think - if we are planning to add re-tries to pldmtool, its better we add it with timeouts in place , otherwise I dont see any value add in adding it.

On reflection, I think this should be `PLDM_REQUESTER_SUCCESS` anyway if we ignore the other aspects for now? Adjusting my score back to 0 for this to be answered.

I dislike this retries patch because it doesn't provide proper retry semantics, it's papering over the fact that libpldm lacks them. Perhaps another tack to take is to make people who want this behaviour retry in a shell loop using the process exit code? Maybe that nudges people towards helping clean up libpldm?

I gave it a +1 because I don't personally want to get in the way of it, but if you have objections also please score it appropriately 😊

The time out is already implemented in libpldm  `pldm_transport_send_recv_msg()` https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/src/transport/transport.c#L207
So retry when there is no responses (time out happens) is reasonable as my opinion.
This patch set provides the option to improve the functional of pldmtool and does not break any functional of pldmtool.

It is good to know that we have the timeouts taken care of in the requester API, this at least sounds better, but the check here as mentioned by @arj should be with `PLDM_REQUESTER_SUCCESS` (https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/691668fe7662d779e6fd000e6e8e6aa7f3c8b17c/src/transport/transport.c#L236) not `PLDM_SUCCESS`.

> I dislike this retries patch because it doesn't provide proper retry semantics, it's papering over the fact that libpldm lacks them

@thu - is this something that you can help with ?

If not, I think I am okay with this patch, as this improves the functionality and does not break anything. Although we think it's a direction that we don't want to go in the long run, we could always come back and remove this code when we have formal retry behavior in libpldm.
Mark the patch set as "Work In progress" for more discussion about the complete solution.
